messageBody:
On Thu, 24 Feb 2005 19:50:06 -0600, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> >
> > To make life easier for our developers I override begin() and end()
> > methods in ServletTestCase ( and reads login cred. from a proeprties
> > file). I cannot do this when extending XMLTestCase.
> >
> > Is it still possible to use ServletTestSuite somehow?
>
> That, I don't know. You'll have to try it. If Vince is around, he can help.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger

How about you keep your existing BaseTestCase which extends
ServletTestCase, define a new abstract class which extends this and
override setUp, calling super.setUpI() as needs be , and initialise
the XMLUnit environment for testing. You then extend this new abstract
class with your concrete TestCases, and can use the static assertXXX
methods of XMLAssert?

class XMLBaseTestCase extends BaseTestCase {
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
super.setUp();

// TODO setup XMLUnit - setControlParser, etc...
}
}

class MyTestCase extends XMLBaseTestCase {
public void testFoo() {
XMLAssert.assertXMLValid("Some.XML.From.Some.Object");
}
}
Not the tidiest of solutions, but it's the best that I can think of at
this time on a Friday night!

James
